name: Kepler-192
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-192 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-192 is a star with 0.9620000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.01 times its radius. It is located 2166.13 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-192 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-192 b

Kepler-192 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.93 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-192.

The mass of Kepler-192 b is 10.76 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-192 b is 2.74 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-192 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-192 c

Kepler-192 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 21.22 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-192.

The mass of Kepler-192 c is 11.30 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-192 c is 2.79 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-192 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-192, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
